abstract: Procedural problems at some large lenders are so prevalent that additional lenders and loan servicers are likely to halt foreclosure proceedings, experts say.
snippet: Procedural problems at some large lenders are so prevalent that additional lenders and loan servicers are likely to halt foreclosure proceedings, experts say.
lead_paragraph: As some of the nation’s largest lenders have conceded that their foreclosure procedures may have been improperly handled, lawsuits have revealed myriad missteps in crucial documents, Gretchen Morgenson writes in The New York Times.

headline.main: Flawed Paperwork Aggravates a Foreclosure Crisis

abstract: Bank of America Merrill Lynch continued to raid Royal Bank of Scotland and Citigroup for senior bankers in Europe, the Middle East and Africa as it added 10 to its corporate banking business on Monday.
snippet: Bank of America Merrill Lynch continued to raid Royal Bank of Scotland and Citigroup for senior bankers in Europe, the Middle East and Africa as it added 10 to its corporate banking business on Monday.

headline.main: BofA Lures Senior Bankers Away From Rivals

abstract: Edwards Group, the private equity-backed vacuum technology firm that is preparing for a sale or flotation, said it “rapidly recovered” from the global downturn and would increase sales and profits further in the second half of the year.
snippet: Edwards Group, the private equity-backed vacuum technology firm that is preparing for a sale or flotation, said it “rapidly recovered” from the global downturn and would increase sales and profits further in the second half of the year.
lead_paragraph: The Edwards Group, the private equity-backed vacuum technology firm that is preparing for a sale or flotation, said it “rapidly recovered” from the global downturn and would grow sales and profits further in the second half of the year, Reuters reported.

headline.main: Edwards, Eyeing a Deal, Sees Stronger 2nd Half

abstract: As the issues related to flaws in the foreclosure process come to light, there are likely to be a wide range of government investigations and private litigation that could hound the banks and others for years to come, says Peter J. Henning in the White Collar Watch column.
snippet: As the issues related to flaws in the foreclosure process come to light, there are likely to be a wide range of government investigations and private litigation that could hound the banks and others for years to come, says Peter J. Henning in the ...
lead_paragraph: Peter J. Henning follows issues involving securities law and white-collar crime for DealBook’s White Collar Watch.

abstract: A Swiss government panel proposed rules that would require the two big banks to hold more capital in reserve than international competitors.
snippet: A Swiss government panel proposed rules that would require the two big banks to hold more capital in reserve than international competitors.
lead_paragraph: A Swiss government panel proposed rules on Monday that would require the nation’s two big banks, UBS and Credit Suisse, to hold more capital in reserve than their international competitors.

headline.main: 2 Swiss Banks Facing Higher Capital Standards
headline.print_headline: 2 Swiss Banks Facing Higher Capital Standards
